factors_considered: Nature and extent of PHI involved, number of individuals affected, whether PHI was actually acquired or viewed, extent of mitigation
methodology: Low probability of compromise assessment, analysis of access logs, encryption status review, unauthorized access investigation
determination: Low probability of compromise - No breach notification required

factors_considered: Unencrypted and unredacted ePHI in transit or at rest, evidence of unauthorized access, media containing PHI lost or stolen
methodology: Risk assessment based on security measures in place, breach risk matrix, probability analysis
determination: Significant risk of compromise exists - Breach notification required

factors_considered: PHI encrypted according to NIST standards, no evidence of unauthorized access, strong access controls in place
methodology: Technical safeguards verification, encryption standard validation, access log analysis
determination: Low probability of compromise - No breach notification required

factors_considered: Impermissible use or disclosure of PHI, unauthorized access by workforce members, loss of unencrypted portable devices
methodology: Investigation of incident, timeline reconstruction, scope determination
determination: Assumed significant risk unless proven otherwise - Breach notification required

factors_considered: Media disposal not following secure procedures, unencrypted backup tapes lost, records containing PHI found in dumpster
methodology: Media tracking and inventory review, destruction documentation verification, forensic analysis
determination: Significant risk of compromise - Breach notification required

factors_considered: Ransomware infection with encryption of ePHI, malware access to patient records, system compromise with PHI exfiltration
methodology: System compromise analysis, malware forensics, data access validation
determination: Significant risk of compromise - Breach notification required

factors_considered: Suspicious network activity detected, failed login attempts, but strong logging shows no actual access achieved
methodology: Network monitoring and IDS analysis, session log review, authentication attempt investigation
determination: Low probability of compromise - No breach notification required

factors_considered: Workforce member accidentally sent PHI to wrong recipient, but recipient did not open or use information, immediate recall
methodology: Email recall verification, recipient cooperation confirmation, data retention review
determination: Low probability of compromise if properly mitigated

factors_considered: Database query results containing PHI sent to external research organization without authorization, recipient binding agreement
methodology: Investigation of access and use, recipient contractual obligations, data use verification
determination: Assessment required - Likely significant risk - Breach notification required

factors_considered: Laptop with whole-disk encryption stolen, temporary employee access, but no evidence of recovery or use
methodology: Device encryption status verification, recovery capability assessment, forensic timeline analysis
determination: Low probability of compromise - No breach notification required
